Articles.Content:
Introducing the Lifting Body 1, built by BeefTenderloin! Enjoy.

BeefTenderloin's Briefing:

The design features revolutionary new in-line wing technologies, giving the LB1 a sleek profile (not because we ran out of glue to attach the delta wings...). It is powered by two state-of-the-art turbojet engines, giving it great capabilities to operate at high altitude. It is very maneuverable and stable.

http://www./view/bb8hnwfc4jtdxod/LB1.craft
Exploiting crappy KSP physics at its best!!!!
Yep! Although there are some real lifting body planes in real life.
I guess it kind of works on the same principle as flying wings.

Yep! Although there are some real lifting body planes in real life.

Oh I know, but this is the only way to do it in KSP as KSP does not calculate aerodynamics on non-wing parts.
It wasn't supposed to be a flying wing, SW4K, but you've given me an idea...
